constraints: The entire system must be fully GDPR compliant.
We cannot use AWS, Azure, or any public cloud. It must be deployed on-premise.

key_facts: User is starting a new project.
The project is a backend for a fintech application using Python.
User decided on FastAPI for the project.
User is using PostgreSQL for the database.
User is using SQLAlchemy 2.0 for the ORM and wants to keep the database layer abstracted.
User wants to use Redis for caching to speed up the read endpoints.
User needs to implement JWT for standard users for authentication.
User must enforce Two-Factor Authentication (2FA) for Admin accounts.
The frontend team is building the dashboard using React.
User requested a GraphQL API alongside the REST endpoints and might use Strawberry for that.
User is planning to use Celery for background tasks due to heavy monthly report generation.
User will use RabbitMQ as the message broker for Celery.
decisions: User decided on FastAPI because of its high performance and native async support.
